My immediate goal is clear: Win this round. I can do it pretty easily with a High Card. I have several options, but my strategy is to maximize efficiency and secure the victory with a simple play. I could use the 3 of Diamonds or the Stone Card. Both should result in more than enough chips.

2. `Play` my High Card.

The core of my approach is to prioritize a direct win. I have a winning hand with over 77,000 chips. The high card (3 of Diamonds) will deliver what I need. Given the usual pattern of these prompts, the action is usually "play" to move forward. Plus, I want to keep Ride the Bus scaling.

So, I re-checked my calculations, just to be sure: a High Card (3 of Diamonds) will result in around 77,000 chips, which, plus my current total of 28,339, means I will have comfortably more than the needed 40,000 chips. Also, my Steel Jokers and Steel cards will give huge multipliers. I also checked if there's any reason to discard and then remembered that these prompts encourage you to take the winning move.

The most efficient plan is to play the High Card. I will go with a High Card to secure the win and move to the shop.
